intro: Phyllanthus cyrtophylloides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological research.
